messages.text: This is the version of the bot for those who haven't have a first aid training.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Bot contains no medical recommendations, only first aid advices to be done until an ambulance comes.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: For the maximum effectiveness get familiar with Fast AID bot beforehand.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Available languages: English (current), русский ( /lang_ru )
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: To change the language, tap the highlighted command.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Think about your own safety before helping anyone else, that's the first and the foremost rule.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: There are around 50 000 people die yearly before ambulance comes. This number could be way smaller, if injured could get the first aid. We’ve created the project @FastAid_bot to make you prepared for extreme situations.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: The project was made up by FAST company team, who are specialized in providing first aid training (and other special skills) to companies and individuals - http://www.FirstAid.in.ua/
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: The project was built and published by https://sayhimedia.com/
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Let's get back to life savings, but start from your own safety.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Important! This section contains recommendations which require special skills.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Tap "Had no training" if you haven't have first aid training.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Do not be afraid!
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Quickly move his head onto your leg or put something soft under it (like jacket or pullover).
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: To prevent injured from hurting his head.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: IMPORTANT! Do not try to open an injured’s mouth and put something between his teeth. This is very dangerous, prevent others from doing it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Follow next steps:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: If you can roll injured to his side.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Hold him, so he couldn't hurt himself.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Especially his head.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: But don't try to immobilize him or push him too hard, that might harm.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Call the ambulance:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Shout out for others to help.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Call the ambulance number or ask somebody to do it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Tell the ambulance: what happened, where, rough age of injured person, gender. Answer to all operator’s questions. Operator should hang up first.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure there is somebody to meet an ambulance crew.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: You did everything you could, thanks for not being indifferent.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Tell your friends and relatives about @FastAid_bot
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: It's really important for everyone to know how to do first aid.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Choose one of the options below, what happened to the injured person:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Clarify what's happened and ask if medical aid is needed.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Shout out for others to help.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Call the ambulance number or ask somebody to do it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Tell the ambulance: what happened, where, rough age of injured person, gender. Answer to all operator’s questions. Operator should hang up first.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure there is somebody to meet an ambulance crew.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Choose one of the options below, what happened to the injured person:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Talk to him, ask loudly: "Can you hear me? Are you okay?"
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Please, clarify the question below:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Have you noticed any critical changes in injured’s behavior? Like sudden blindness, disorientation, heavy dizziness, etc.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Check for the next symptoms:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Labored breathing
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: A chest pain which is referred to the neck, arm or stomach.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Cold sweat, fear.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Does injured has any of these symptoms?
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: You did everything you could, thanks for not being indifferent.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Tell your friends and relatives about @FastAid_bot
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: It's really important for everyone to know how to do first aid.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Shout out for others to help.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Call the ambulance number or ask somebody to do it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Tell the ambulance: what happened, where, rough age of injured person, gender. Answer to all operator’s questions. Operator should hang up first.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure there is somebody to meet an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Turn an injured as shown in the video below. If possible prevent him from getting cold.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Ask injured not to move, this is very important.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Put some soft fabric under the broken limb, ensuring injured's comfort.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. If injured broke his arm but is able to hold it with a healthy one - do not prevent it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Don't try to repair a fracture or splint it. That might make things worse.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure an ambulance is coming and there is somebody to meet it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: If there is still no ambulance do next:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: a. Write down injured's first and last name.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: b. Ask his relatives or close people contacts to tell them about the incident.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: c. Wait till an ambulance comes, if you can.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: d. Talk to him.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Most likely it is not a heart attack.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Nevertheless, if you have some doubts, better call an ambulance to be safe.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Call the ambulance:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Shout out for others to help.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Call the ambulance number or ask somebody to do it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Tell the ambulance: what happened, where, rough age of injured person, gender. Answer to all operator’s questions. Operator should hang up first.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure there is somebody to meet an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: IMPORTANT! Do not let injured drink or eat until an ambulance comes.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Provide him comfort, talk to him and make sure he has fresh fresh air (open a window, for ex.)
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Shout out for others to help.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Call the ambulance number or ask somebody to do it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Tell the ambulance: what happened, where, rough age of injured person, gender. Answer to all operator’s questions. Operator should hang up first.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure there is somebody to meet an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 5. Control his status.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: You did everything you could, thanks for not being indifferent.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Tell your friends and relatives about @FastAid_bot
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: It's really important for everyone to know how to do first aid.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Write down injured's first and last name.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: b. Ask his relatives or close people contacts to tell them about the incident.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: c. Wait till an ambulance comes, if you can.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: d. Talk to him.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Ask an injured to smile. Does his smile look symmetrical?
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: You did everything you could, thanks for not being indifferent.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Tell your friends and relatives about @FastAid_bot
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: It's really important for everyone to know how to do first aid.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Provide this person a comfort:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Loosen up his tight clothes, the belt, watchband, unbutton a shirt.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Provide fresh air, open a window.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Ask if his therapist prescribed him some medications. If yes and he has them, help taking them in a single dose.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Let him chew an aspirin pill, preliminarily making sure he doesn't have an allergy to it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 5. Control his status.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Cal someone to help you, if possible.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Call the ambulance number or ask somebody to do it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Tell the ambulance: what happened, where, child’s age, gender. Answer to all operator’s questions. Operator should hang up first.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure there is somebody to meet an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 5. Wait an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: You did everything you could, thanks for not being indifferent.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Tell your friends and relatives about @FastAid_bot
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: It's really important for everyone to know how to do first aid.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Make sure the clothes aren't on fire and do not smolder, the burn reason is eliminated.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Who's injured - a child or an adult?
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: You did everything you could, thanks for not being indifferent.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Tell your friends and relatives about @FastAid_bot
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: It's really important for everyone to know how to do first aid.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Ask injured not to move, as movement can harm even more.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Ask injured if he needs any medical aid. If he got injured or asks to call an ambulance - call it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Shout out for others to help.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Call an ambulance or ask somebody to do it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 5. Tell the ambulance: what happened, where, rough age of injured person, gender. Answer to all operator’s questions. Operator should hang up first.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 6. Make sure there is somebody to meet an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Ask injured to raise both hands in front of him. Does he keep them symmetrically?
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Protect an accident area using any available method: an emergency sign (triangle), other cars alarms, cones, bright vests, etc.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Ask accident participants if they need any medical aid. If any of them are injured or they ask for a help - CALL AN AMBULANCE.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Try to define who's got the most heavy injures. For ex., a pedestrian who was hit by a car.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Ask injured not to move, as movement can harm even more.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Put the injured into a safe position.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Wait for an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: You did everything you could, thanks for not being indifferent.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Tell your friends and relatives about @FastAid_bot
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: It's really important for everyone to know how to do first aid.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Ask loudly: "Have you choked?".
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: How an injured responded?
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Children burns are dangerous, but it's up to you calling an ambulance or not.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: In next cases calling an ambulance is essential:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Burn takes big area (more than 5 child's palms).
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Feet, hands, face or groin are burned.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Deep burns.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Cool a burn with a cold tap water, until the child feels cold.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: But don't do it for longer than 20 minutes.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: When he feels cold, stop watering a burn.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Did he burn limbs or a body?
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Shout out for others to help.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Call the ambulance number or ask somebody to do it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Tell the ambulance: what happened, where, rough age of injured person, gender. Answer to all operator’s questions. Operator should hang up first.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure there is somebody to meet an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Ask him to say a simple sentence, for ex.: "The weather is great today".
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: He said it distinctly?
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: In current case your capabilities are very limited.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Try to prevent an injured from getting cold.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Use clothes, blankets or other stuff around.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: a. Write down injured's first and last name.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: b. Ask his relatives or close people contacts to tell them about the incident.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: c. Wait till an ambulance comes, if you can.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: d. Talk to him.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Ask injured not to move, this is very important.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Put some soft fabric under the broken limb, ensuring injured's comfort.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. If injured broke his arm but is able to hold it with a healthy one - do not prevent it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Don't try to repair a fracture or splint it. That might make things worse.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure an ambulance is coming and there is somebody to meet it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: If there is still no ambulance do next:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: a. Write down injured's first and last name.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: b. Ask his relatives or close people contacts to tell them about the incident.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: c. Wait till an ambulance comes, if you can.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: d. Talk to him.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Ask injured to press and hold his wound tightly. It should slow down the bleeding.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Shout out for others to help.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Call the ambulance number or ask somebody to do it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Tell the ambulance: what happened, where, rough age of injured person, gender. Answer to all operator’s questions. Operator should hang up first.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 5. Make sure there is somebody to meet an ambulance crew.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. You must wear up medical gloves or some alternative.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Press the wound tightly. Press the source of the bleeding.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. If there some people around ask them to bring bandages or find a piece of a clean fabric (a t-shirt, towel, sheets, etc.)
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Crumple the fabric and strongly press the wound, as shown in the video:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Keep pressing the wound until an ambulance comes.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Ask somebody to do next:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: a. Write down injured's first and last name.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: b. Ask his relatives or close people contacts to tell them about the incident.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: c. Wait till an ambulance comes, if you can.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: d. Talk to him.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: In current case your capabilities are very limited.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Try to prevent an injured from getting cold.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Use clothes, blankets or other stuff around.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: a. Write down injured's first and last name.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: b. Ask his relatives or close people contacts to tell them about the incident.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: c. Wait till an ambulance comes, if you can.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: d. Talk to him.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Ask injured not to move, this is very important.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Put some soft fabric under the broken limb, ensuring injured's comfort.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. If injured broke his arm but is able to hold it with a healthy one - do not prevent it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Don't try to repair a fracture or splint it. That might make things worse.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure an ambulance is coming and there is somebody to meet it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: If there is still no ambulance do next:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: a. Write down injured's first and last name.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: b. Ask his relatives or close people contacts to tell them about the incident.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: c. Wait till an ambulance comes, if you can.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: d. Talk to him.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. You must wear up medical gloves or some alternative.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Press the wound tightly. Press the source of the bleeding.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. If there some people around ask them to bring bandages or find a piece of a clean fabric (a t-shirt, towel, sheets, etc.)
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Crumple the fabric and strongly press the wound, as shown in the video:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Keep pressing the wound until an ambulance comes.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Ask somebody to do next:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: a. Write down injured's first and last name.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: b. Ask his relatives or close people contacts to tell them about the incident.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: c. Wait till an ambulance comes, if you can.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: d. Talk to him.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Do not interfere!
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Do not give him water and don't hit his back.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Tell to keep coughing and calm him down, slightly lean him forward.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Injured might have only couple of minutes left.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Ask somebody to call an ambulance and if anyone can do the Heimlich maneuver.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: If no, you should do it yourself: lean injured forward, make 5 back slaps, then 5 quick and strong abdomen presses. Repeat until expectorates.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Cool the burns with cold tap water, while waiting for an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: If injured tells that he feels cold, stop watering.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Wait an ambulance, caring of his breathing and remaining conscious.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: If there are no critical behavior changes and the injured successfully passed a test for mimics, coordination and speech, most likely it's not a stroke.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Nevertheless, if you have some doubts, better call an ambulance to be safe.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. You must wear up medical gloves or some alternative.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Press the wound tightly. Press the source of the bleeding.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. If there some people around ask them to bring bandages or find a piece of a clean fabric (a t-shirt, towel, sheets, etc.)
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Crumple the fabric and strongly press the wound, as shown in the video:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Keep pressing the wound until an ambulance comes.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: a. Write down injured's first and last name.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: b. Ask his relatives or close people contacts to tell them about the incident.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: c. Wait till an ambulance comes, if you can.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: d. Talk to him.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: If a burn area is extensive, call an ambulance:
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Shout out for others to help.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Call the ambulance number or ask somebody to do it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Tell the ambulance: what happened, where, rough age of injured person, gender. Answer to all operator’s questions. Operator should hang up first.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure there is somebody to meet an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Cool the burn with cold tap water.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: But don't do it for longer than 20 minutes.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: When he feels cold, stop watering a burn.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Call an ambulance at your discretion.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: In next cases calling an ambulance is essential: burn takes big area (more than 5 palms); feet, hands, face or groin are burned, burns are deep.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Cool the burn with cold tap water, until he starts feeling cold.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Stop watering a burn when he feels cold.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. When he'll start feeling the burning cool it again until he feels cold.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Repeat until injured stops feeling the pain from the burn.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 5. But no longer than for 25 minutes.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Call an ambulance at your discretion.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: In next cases calling an ambulance is essential: burn takes big area (more than 5 palms); feet, hands, face or groin are burned, burns are deep.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Injured might have only couple of minutes left.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Ask somebody to call an ambulance and if anyone can do the Heimlich maneuver.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: If no, you should do it yourself: lean injured forward, make 5 back slaps, then 5 quick and strong abdomen presses. Repeat until expectorates.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: Put the injured into a safe position.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 1. Shout out for others to help. Maybe somebody had a first aid training and can perform a reanimation.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 2. Call the ambulance number or ask somebody to do it.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 3. Tell the ambulance: what happened, where, rough age of injured person, gender. Answer to all operator’s questions. Operator should hang up first.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: 4. Make sure there is somebody to meet an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: You haven't had a first aid training, therefore can do nothing more to help without these special skills. Wait an ambulance.
messages.speaker: eva

messages.text: You did everything you could, thanks for not being indifferent.
